unnormalised: Okay, here's a Quora post on Exam Prep Apps in the Education Technology category:
normalised: What are some must-have exam prep apps for students in India?

unnormalised: **What are some must-have exam prep apps for students in India?**
normalised: Alright folks, let's talk exam prep! As someone who survived the J E E (barely!), I know the struggle is real. Gone are the days of just relying on N C E R T textbooks and handwritten notes – E D Tech is here to stay, and it's making exam prep way more accessible, especially for students from smaller towns like my cousin, Priya, in Kanpur.

unnormalised: Alright folks, let's talk exam prep! As someone who survived the JEE (barely!), I know the struggle is real. Gone are the days of just relying on NCERT textbooks and handwritten notes – EdTech is here to stay, and it's making exam prep way more accessible, especially for students from smaller towns like my cousin, Priya, in Kanpur.
normalised: So, what apps are actually worth the hype?

unnormalised: So, what apps are actually worth the hype?
normalised: First off, Gradeup (now B Y J U'S Exam Prep) is pretty solid. They’ve got a wide range of mock tests and study material for everything from U P S C to bank exams. My friend, Rohan, swore by their daily quizzes when he was prepping for his S B I P O exam last year.

unnormalised: First off, **Gradeup (now BYJU'S Exam Prep)** is pretty solid. They’ve got a wide range of mock tests and study material for everything from UPSC to bank exams. My friend, Rohan, swore by their daily quizzes when he was prepping for his SBI PO exam last year.
normalised: Then there's Testbook. It’s particularly good if you’re preparing for government exams. They often have really affordable test series – you can sometimes snag them for like rupees two hundred and ninety nine.

unnormalised: Then there's **Testbook**. It’s particularly good if you’re preparing for government exams. They often have really affordable test series – you can sometimes snag them for like Rs. 299.
normalised: For cracking entrance exams like N E E T, N E E T prep and Aakash Digital plus Byju’s provide comprehensive coaching and mock tests relevant to the syllabus, especially important now with the competitive cutoffs, reaching as high as seven hundred divided by seven hundred and twenty in some categories. I still remember the stress back in two thousand and twelve!

unnormalised: For cracking entrance exams like NEET, **NEETprep** and **Aakash Digital + Byju’s** provide comprehensive coaching and mock tests relevant to the syllabus, especially important now with the competitive cutoffs, reaching as high as 700/720 in some categories. I still remember the stress back in 2012!
normalised: Don’t forget Unacademy either! They have a massive library of video lectures and live classes, covering almost every exam imaginable. Plus, the educators are often really engaging. Remember to check the dates for live quizzes and special classes, they usually have them at fifteen hundred hours daily.

unnormalised: Don’t forget **Unacademy** either! They have a massive library of video lectures and live classes, covering almost every exam imaginable. Plus, the educators are often really engaging. Remember to check the dates for live quizzes and special classes, they usually have them at 15:00 hrs daily.
normalised: Lastly, if you need help with general aptitude or C A T, I M S Learning Resources also has a good mobile app to prepare. Good luck to all the aspirants and remember to take breaks (and eat some jalebis!) leading to that fateful day, such as fourth May two thousand and twenty four. Try to sleep at least eight hours the night before the exams, even if that seems impossible after studying all night until three A M! Good luck!!

unnormalised: Lastly, if you need help with general aptitude or CAT, **IMS Learning Resources** also has a good mobile app to prepare. Good luck to all the aspirants and remember to take breaks (and eat some jalebis!) leading to that fateful day, such as 04/05/2024. Try to sleep at least 8 hours the night before the exams, even if that seems impossible after studying all night until 03:00 AM! Good luck!!
